definition: to arouse especially mutual enmity or indifference in (someone) where there had formerly been love, affection, or friendliness : alienate
examples: John's excesses gradually estranged him from his mother …
She became estranged from her family.

definition: to remove from customary environment or associations
examples: The first words spoken were not those of one becoming estranged from this world, and already permitted to stray at times into realms foreign to the living.
